00033 #include <Python.h>

00041 #define EULER_SIZE 3
00042 
00043 //----------------------------------mathutils.Euler() -------------------
00044 //makes a new euler for you to play with
00045 static PyObject *Euler_new(PyTypeObject *type, PyObject *args, PyObject *kwds)
00046 {
00047     PyObject *seq = NULL;
00048     const char *order_str = NULL;
00049 
00050     float eul[EULER_SIZE] = {0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f};
00051     short order = EULER_ORDER_XYZ;
00052 
00053     if (kwds && PyDict_Size(kwds)) {
00054         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
00055                         "mathutils.Euler(): "
00056                         "takes no keyword args");
00057         return NULL;
00058     }
00059 
00060     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "|Os:mathutils.Euler", &seq, &order_str))
00061         return NULL;
00062 
00063     switch (PyTuple_GET_SIZE(args)) {
00064         case 0:
00065             break;
00066         case 2:
00067             if ((order = euler_order_from_string(order_str, "mathutils.Euler()")) == -1)
00068                 return NULL;
00069         /* intentionally pass through */
00070         case 1:
00071             if (mathutils_array_parse(eul, EULER_SIZE, EULER_SIZE, seq, "mathutils.Euler()") == -1)
00072                 return NULL;
00073             break;
00074     }
00075     return Euler_CreatePyObject(eul, order, Py_NEW, type);
00076 }
00077 
00078 /* internal use, assume read callback is done */
00079 static const char *euler_order_str(EulerObject *self)
00080 {
00081     static const char order[][4] = {"XYZ", "XZY", "YXZ", "YZX", "ZXY", "ZYX"};
00082     return order[self->order - EULER_ORDER_XYZ];
00083 }
00084 
00085 short euler_order_from_string(const char *str, const char *error_prefix)
00086 {
00087     if ((str[0] && str[1] && str[2] && str[3] == '\0')) {
00088         switch (*((PY_INT32_T *)str)) {
00089             case 'X' | 'Y' << 8 | 'Z' << 16:    return EULER_ORDER_XYZ;
00090             case 'X' | 'Z' << 8 | 'Y' << 16:    return EULER_ORDER_XZY;
00091             case 'Y' | 'X' << 8 | 'Z' << 16:    return EULER_ORDER_YXZ;
00092             case 'Y' | 'Z' << 8 | 'X' << 16:    return EULER_ORDER_YZX;
00093             case 'Z' | 'X' << 8 | 'Y' << 16:    return EULER_ORDER_ZXY;
00094             case 'Z' | 'Y' << 8 | 'X' << 16:    return EULER_ORDER_ZYX;
00095         }
00096     }
00097 
00098     PyErr_Format(PyExc_ValueError,
00099                  "%s: invalid euler order '%s'",
00100                  error_prefix, str);
00101     return -1;
00102 }
00103 
00104 /* note: BaseMath_ReadCallback must be called beforehand */
00105 static PyObject *Euler_ToTupleExt(EulerObject *self, int ndigits)
00106 {
00107     PyObject *ret;
00108     int i;
00109 
00110     ret = PyTuple_New(EULER_SIZE);
00111 
00112     if (ndigits >= 0) {
00113         for (i = 0; i < EULER_SIZE; i++) {
00114             PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, i, PyFloat_FromDouble(double_round((double)self->eul[i], ndigits)));
00115         }
00116     }
00117     else {
00118         for (i = 0; i < EULER_SIZE; i++) {
00119             PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, i, PyFloat_FromDouble(self->eul[i]));
00120         }
00121     }
00122 
00123     return ret;
00124 }

00129 PyDoc_STRVAR(Euler_to_quaternion_doc,
00130 ".. method:: to_quaternion()\n"
00131 "\n"
00132 "   Return a quaternion representation of the euler.\n"
00133 "\n"
00134 "   :return: Quaternion representation of the euler.\n"
00135 "   :rtype: :class:`Quaternion`\n"
00136 );
00137 static PyObject *Euler_to_quaternion(EulerObject *self)
00138 {
00139     float quat[4];
00140 
00141     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(self) == -1)
00142         return NULL;
00143 
00144     eulO_to_quat(quat, self->eul, self->order);
00145 
00146     return Quaternion_CreatePyObject(quat, Py_NEW, NULL);
00147 }

00149 //return a matrix representation of the euler
00150 PyDoc_STRVAR(Euler_to_matrix_doc,
00151 ".. method:: to_matrix()\n"
00152 "\n"
00153 "   Return a matrix representation of the euler.\n"
00154 "\n"
00155 "   :return: A 3x3 roation matrix representation of the euler.\n"
00156 "   :rtype: :class:`Matrix`\n"
00157 );
00158 static PyObject *Euler_to_matrix(EulerObject *self)
00159 {
00160     float mat[9];
00161 
00162     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(self) == -1)
00163         return NULL;
00164 
00165     eulO_to_mat3((float (*)[3])mat, self->eul, self->order);
00166 
00167     return Matrix_CreatePyObject(mat, 3, 3, Py_NEW, NULL);
00168 }

00174 );
00175 static PyObject *Euler_zero(EulerObject *self)
00176 {
00177     zero_v3(self->eul);
00178 
00179     if (BaseMath_WriteCallback(self) == -1)
00180         return NULL;
00181 
00182     Py_RETURN_NONE;
00183 }

00185 PyDoc_STRVAR(Euler_rotate_axis_doc,
00186 ".. method:: rotate_axis(axis, angle)\n"
00187 "\n"
00188 "   Rotates the euler a certain amount and returning a unique euler rotation\n"
00189 "   (no 720 degree pitches).\n"
00190 "\n"
00191 "   :arg axis: single character in ['X, 'Y', 'Z'].\n"
00192 "   :type axis: string\n"
00193 "   :arg angle: angle in radians.\n"
00194 "   :type angle: float\n"
00195 );
00196 static PyObject *Euler_rotate_axis(EulerObject *self, PyObject *args)
00197 {
00198     float angle = 0.0f;
00199     int axis; /* actually a character */
00200 
00201     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "Cf:rotate_axis", &axis, &angle)) {
00202         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
00203                         "Euler.rotate_axis(): "
00204                         "expected an axis 'X', 'Y', 'Z' and an angle (float)");
00205         return NULL;
00206     }
00207 
00208     if (!(ELEM3(axis, 'X', 'Y', 'Z'))) {
00209         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00210                         "Euler.rotate_axis(): "
00211                         "expected axis to be 'X', 'Y' or 'Z'");
00212         return NULL;
00213     }
00214 
00215     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(self) == -1)
00216         return NULL;
00217 
00218 
00219     rotate_eulO(self->eul, self->order, (char)axis, angle);
00220 
00221     (void)BaseMath_WriteCallback(self);
00222 
00223     Py_RETURN_NONE;
00224 }
00225 
00226 PyDoc_STRVAR(Euler_rotate_doc,
00227 ".. method:: rotate(other)\n"
00228 "\n"
00229 "   Rotates the euler a by another mathutils value.\n"
00230 "\n"
00231 "   :arg other: rotation component of mathutils value\n"
00232 "   :type other: :class:`Euler`, :class:`Quaternion` or :class:`Matrix`\n"
00233 );
00234 static PyObject *Euler_rotate(EulerObject *self, PyObject *value)
00235 {
00236     float self_rmat[3][3], other_rmat[3][3], rmat[3][3];
00237 
00238     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(self) == -1)
00239         return NULL;
00240 
00241     if (mathutils_any_to_rotmat(other_rmat, value, "euler.rotate(value)") == -1)
00242         return NULL;
00243 
00244     eulO_to_mat3(self_rmat, self->eul, self->order);
00245     mul_m3_m3m3(rmat, other_rmat, self_rmat);
00246 
00247     mat3_to_compatible_eulO(self->eul, self->eul, self->order, rmat);
00248 
00249     (void)BaseMath_WriteCallback(self);
00250     Py_RETURN_NONE;
00251 }

00253 PyDoc_STRVAR(Euler_make_compatible_doc,
00254 ".. method:: make_compatible(other)\n"
00255 "\n"
00256 "   Make this euler compatible with another,\n"
00257 "   so interpolating between them works as intended.\n"
00258 "\n"
00259 "   .. note:: the rotation order is not taken into account for this function.\n"
00260 );
00261 static PyObject *Euler_make_compatible(EulerObject *self, PyObject *value)
00262 {
00263     float teul[EULER_SIZE];
00264 
00265     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(self) == -1)
00266         return NULL;
00267 
00268     if (mathutils_array_parse(teul, EULER_SIZE, EULER_SIZE, value,
00269                               "euler.make_compatible(other), invalid 'other' arg") == -1)
00270     {
00271         return NULL;
00272     }
00273 
00274     compatible_eul(self->eul, teul);
00275 
00276     (void)BaseMath_WriteCallback(self);
00277 
00278     Py_RETURN_NONE;
00279 }

00284 PyDoc_STRVAR(Euler_copy_doc,
00285 ".. function:: copy()\n"
00286 "\n"
00287 "   Returns a copy of this euler.\n"
00288 "\n"
00289 "   :return: A copy of the euler.\n"
00290 "   :rtype: :class:`Euler`\n"
00291 "\n"
00292 "   .. note:: use this to get a copy of a wrapped euler with\n"
00293 "      no reference to the original data.\n"
00294 );
00295 static PyObject *Euler_copy(EulerObject *self)
00296 {
00297     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(self) == -1)
00298         return NULL;
00299 
00300     return Euler_CreatePyObject(self->eul, self->order, Py_NEW, Py_TYPE(self));
00301 }
00302 static PyObject *Euler_deepcopy(EulerObject *self, PyObject *args)
00303 {
00304     if (!mathutils_deepcopy_args_check(args))
00305         return NULL;
00306     return Euler_copy(self);
00307 }

00309 //----------------------------print object (internal)--------------
00310 //print the object to screen
00311 
00312 static PyObject *Euler_repr(EulerObject *self)
00313 {
00314     PyObject *ret, *tuple;
00315 
00316     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(self) == -1)
00317         return NULL;
00318 
00319     tuple = Euler_ToTupleExt(self, -1);
00320 
00321     ret = PyUnicode_FromFormat("Euler(%R, '%s')", tuple, euler_order_str(self));
00322 
00323     Py_DECREF(tuple);
00324     return ret;
00325 }
00326 
00327 static PyObject *Euler_str(EulerObject *self)
00328 {
00329     DynStr *ds;
00330 
00331     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(self) == -1)
00332         return NULL;
00333 
00334     ds = BLI_dynstr_new();
00335 
00336     BLI_dynstr_appendf(ds, "<Euler (x=%.4f, y=%.4f, z=%.4f), order='%s'>",
00337                        self->eul[0], self->eul[1], self->eul[2], euler_order_str(self));
00338 
00339     return mathutils_dynstr_to_py(ds); /* frees ds */
00340 }
00341 
00342 static PyObject *Euler_richcmpr(PyObject *a, PyObject *b, int op)
00343 {
00344     PyObject *res;
00345     int ok = -1; /* zero is true */
00346 
00347     if (EulerObject_Check(a) && EulerObject_Check(b)) {
00348         EulerObject *eulA = (EulerObject *)a;
00349         EulerObject *eulB = (EulerObject *)b;
00350 
00351         if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(eulA) == -1 || BaseMath_ReadCallback(eulB) == -1)
00352             return NULL;
00353 
00354         ok = ((eulA->order == eulB->order) && EXPP_VectorsAreEqual(eulA->eul, eulB->eul, EULER_SIZE, 1)) ? 0 : -1;
00355     }
00356 
00357     switch (op) {
00358         case Py_NE:
00359             ok = !ok; /* pass through */
00360         case Py_EQ:
00361             res = ok ? Py_False : Py_True;
00362             break;
00363 
00364         case Py_LT:
00365         case Py_LE:
00366         case Py_GT:
00367         case Py_GE:
00368             res = Py_NotImplemented;
00369             break;
00370         default:
00371             PyErr_BadArgument();
00372             return NULL;
00373     }
00374 
00375     return Py_INCREF(res), res;
00376 }

00378 //---------------------SEQUENCE PROTOCOLS------------------------
00379 //----------------------------len(object)------------------------
00380 //sequence length
00381 static int Euler_len(EulerObject *UNUSED(self))
00382 {
00383     return EULER_SIZE;
00384 }
00385 //----------------------------object[]---------------------------
00386 //sequence accessor (get)
00387 static PyObject *Euler_item(EulerObject *self, int i)
00388 {
00389     if (i < 0) i = EULER_SIZE - i;
00390 
00391     if (i < 0 || i >= EULER_SIZE) {
00392         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_IndexError,
00393                         "euler[attribute]: "
00394                         "array index out of range");
00395         return NULL;
00396     }
00397 
00398     if (BaseMath_ReadIndexCallback(self, i) == -1)
00399         return NULL;
00400 
00401     return PyFloat_FromDouble(self->eul[i]);
00402 
00403 }
00404 //----------------------------object[]-------------------------
00405 //sequence accessor (set)
00406 static int Euler_ass_item(EulerObject *self, int i, PyObject *value)
00407 {
00408     float f = PyFloat_AsDouble(value);
00409 
00410     if (f == -1 && PyErr_Occurred()) { // parsed item not a number
00411         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
00412                         "euler[attribute] = x: "
00413                         "argument not a number");
00414         return -1;
00415     }
00416 
00417     if (i < 0) i = EULER_SIZE - i;
00418 
00419     if (i < 0 || i >= EULER_SIZE) {
00420         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_IndexError,
00421                         "euler[attribute] = x: "
00422                         "array assignment index out of range");
00423         return -1;
00424     }
00425 
00426     self->eul[i] = f;
00427 
00428     if (BaseMath_WriteIndexCallback(self, i) == -1)
00429         return -1;
00430 
00431     return 0;
00432 }
00433 //----------------------------object[z:y]------------------------
00434 //sequence slice (get)
00435 static PyObject *Euler_slice(EulerObject *self, int begin, int end)
00436 {
00437     PyObject *tuple;
00438     int count;
00439 
00440     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(self) == -1)
00441         return NULL;
00442 
00443     CLAMP(begin, 0, EULER_SIZE);
00444     if (end < 0) end = (EULER_SIZE + 1) + end;
00445     CLAMP(end, 0, EULER_SIZE);
00446     begin = MIN2(begin, end);
00447 
00448     tuple = PyTuple_New(end - begin);
00449     for (count = begin; count < end; count++) {
00450         PyTuple_SET_ITEM(tuple, count - begin, PyFloat_FromDouble(self->eul[count]));
00451     }
00452 
00453     return tuple;
00454 }
00455 //----------------------------object[z:y]------------------------
00456 //sequence slice (set)
00457 static int Euler_ass_slice(EulerObject *self, int begin, int end, PyObject *seq)
00458 {
00459     int i, size;
00460     float eul[EULER_SIZE];
00461 
00462     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(self) == -1)
00463         return -1;
00464 
00465     CLAMP(begin, 0, EULER_SIZE);
00466     if (end < 0) end = (EULER_SIZE + 1) + end;
00467     CLAMP(end, 0, EULER_SIZE);
00468     begin = MIN2(begin, end);
00469 
00470     if ((size = mathutils_array_parse(eul, 0, EULER_SIZE, seq, "mathutils.Euler[begin:end] = []")) == -1)
00471         return -1;
00472 
00473     if (size != (end - begin)) {
00474         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00475                         "euler[begin:end] = []: "
00476                         "size mismatch in slice assignment");
00477         return -1;
00478     }
00479 
00480     for (i = 0; i < EULER_SIZE; i++)
00481         self->eul[begin + i] = eul[i];
00482 
00483     (void)BaseMath_WriteCallback(self);
00484     return 0;
00485 }
00486 
00487 static PyObject *Euler_subscript(EulerObject *self, PyObject *item)
00488 {
00489     if (PyIndex_Check(item)) {
00490         Py_ssize_t i;
00491         i = PyNumber_AsSsize_t(item, PyExc_IndexError);
00492         if (i == -1 && PyErr_Occurred())
00493             return NULL;
00494         if (i < 0)
00495             i += EULER_SIZE;
00496         return Euler_item(self, i);
00497     }
00498     else if (PySlice_Check(item)) {
00499         Py_ssize_t start, stop, step, slicelength;
00500 
00501         if (PySlice_GetIndicesEx((void *)item, EULER_SIZE, &start, &stop, &step, &slicelength) < 0)
00502             return NULL;
00503 
00504         if (slicelength <= 0) {
00505             return PyTuple_New(0);
00506         }
00507         else if (step == 1) {
00508             return Euler_slice(self, start, stop);
00509         }
00510         else {
00511             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_IndexError,
00512                             "slice steps not supported with eulers");
00513             return NULL;
00514         }
00515     }
00516     else {
00517         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00518                      "euler indices must be integers, not %.200s",
00519                      Py_TYPE(item)->tp_name);
00520         return NULL;
00521     }
00522 }
00523 
00524 
00525 static int Euler_ass_subscript(EulerObject *self, PyObject *item, PyObject *value)
00526 {
00527     if (PyIndex_Check(item)) {
00528         Py_ssize_t i = PyNumber_AsSsize_t(item, PyExc_IndexError);
00529         if (i == -1 && PyErr_Occurred())
00530             return -1;
00531         if (i < 0)
00532             i += EULER_SIZE;
00533         return Euler_ass_item(self, i, value);
00534     }
00535     else if (PySlice_Check(item)) {
00536         Py_ssize_t start, stop, step, slicelength;
00537 
00538         if (PySlice_GetIndicesEx((void *)item, EULER_SIZE, &start, &stop, &step, &slicelength) < 0)
00539             return -1;
00540 
00541         if (step == 1)
00542             return Euler_ass_slice(self, start, stop, value);
00543         else {
00544             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_IndexError,
00545                             "slice steps not supported with euler");
00546             return -1;
00547         }
00548     }
00549     else {
00550         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00551                      "euler indices must be integers, not %.200s",
00552                      Py_TYPE(item)->tp_name);
00553         return -1;
00554     }
00555 }

00559     (lenfunc) Euler_len,                    /* sq_length */
00560     (binaryfunc) NULL,                      /* sq_concat */
00561     (ssizeargfunc) NULL,                    /* sq_repeat */
00562     (ssizeargfunc) Euler_item,              /* sq_item */
00563     (ssizessizeargfunc) NULL,               /* sq_slice, deprecated  */
00564     (ssizeobjargproc) Euler_ass_item,       /* sq_ass_item */
00565     (ssizessizeobjargproc) NULL,            /* sq_ass_slice, deprecated */
00566     (objobjproc) NULL,                      /* sq_contains */
00567     (binaryfunc) NULL,                      /* sq_inplace_concat */
00568     (ssizeargfunc) NULL,                    /* sq_inplace_repeat */
00569 };

00572     (lenfunc)Euler_len,

00582 static PyObject *Euler_axis_get(EulerObject *self, void *type)

00591 
00592 /* rotation order */
00593 
00594 PyDoc_STRVAR(Euler_order_doc,
00595 "Euler rotation order.\n\n:type: string in ['XYZ', 'XZY', 'YXZ', 'YZX', 'ZXY', 'ZYX']"
00596 );
00597 static PyObject *Euler_order_get(EulerObject *self, void *UNUSED(closure))
00598 {
00599     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(self) == -1) /* can read order too */
00600         return NULL;
00601 
00602     return PyUnicode_FromString(euler_order_str(self));
00603 }
00604 
00605 static int Euler_order_set(EulerObject *self, PyObject *value, void *UNUSED(closure))
00606 {
00607     const char *order_str = _PyUnicode_AsString(value);
00608     short order = euler_order_from_string(order_str, "euler.order");
00609 
00610     if (order == -1)
00611         return -1;
00612 
00613     self->order = order;
00614     (void)BaseMath_WriteCallback(self); /* order can be written back */
00615     return 0;
00616 }

00618 /*****************************************************************************/
00619 /* Python attributes get/set structure:                                      */
00620 /*****************************************************************************/
00621 static PyGetSetDef Euler_getseters[] = {
00622     {(char *)"x", (getter)Euler_axis_get, (setter)Euler_axis_set, Euler_axis_doc, (void *)0},
00623     {(char *)"y", (getter)Euler_axis_get, (setter)Euler_axis_set, Euler_axis_doc, (void *)1},
00624     {(char *)"z", (getter)Euler_axis_get, (setter)Euler_axis_set, Euler_axis_doc, (void *)2},
00625     {(char *)"order", (getter)Euler_order_get, (setter)Euler_order_set, Euler_order_doc, (void *)NULL},
00626 
00627     {(char *)"is_wrapped", (getter)BaseMathObject_is_wrapped_get, (setter)NULL, BaseMathObject_is_wrapped_doc, NULL},
00628     {(char *)"owner", (getter)BaseMathObject_owner_get, (setter)NULL, BaseMathObject_owner_doc, NULL},
00629     {NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL}  /* Sentinel */
00630 };

00699 //------------------------Euler_CreatePyObject (internal)-------------
00700 //creates a new euler object
00701 /* pass Py_WRAP - if vector is a WRAPPER for data allocated by BLENDER
00702  * (i.e. it was allocated elsewhere by MEM_mallocN())
00703  * pass Py_NEW - if vector is not a WRAPPER and managed by PYTHON
00704  * (i.e. it must be created here with PyMEM_malloc())*/
00705 PyObject *Euler_CreatePyObject(float *eul, short order, int type, PyTypeObject *base_type)
00706 {
00707     EulerObject *self;
00708 
00709     self = base_type ?  (EulerObject *)base_type->tp_alloc(base_type, 0) :
00710                         (EulerObject *)PyObject_GC_New(EulerObject, &euler_Type);
00711 
00712     if (self) {
00713         /* init callbacks as NULL */
00714         self->cb_user = NULL;
00715         self->cb_type = self->cb_subtype = 0;
00716 
00717         if (type == Py_WRAP) {
00718             self->eul = eul;
00719             self->wrapped = Py_WRAP;
00720         }
00721         else if (type == Py_NEW) {
00722             self->eul = PyMem_Malloc(EULER_SIZE * sizeof(float));
00723             if (eul) {
00724                 copy_v3_v3(self->eul, eul);
00725             }
00726             else {
00727                 zero_v3(self->eul);
00728             }
00729 
00730             self->wrapped = Py_NEW;
00731         }
00732         else {
00733             Py_FatalError("Euler(): invalid type!");
00734         }
00735 
00736         self->order = order;
00737     }
00738 
00739     return (PyObject *)self;
00740 }
00741 
00742 PyObject *Euler_CreatePyObject_cb(PyObject *cb_user, short order,
00743                                   unsigned char cb_type, unsigned char cb_subtype)
00744 {
00745     EulerObject *self = (EulerObject *)Euler_CreatePyObject(NULL, order, Py_NEW, NULL);
00746     if (self) {
00747         Py_INCREF(cb_user);
00748         self->cb_user         = cb_user;
00749         self->cb_type         = cb_type;
00750         self->cb_subtype      = cb_subtype;
00751         PyObject_GC_Track(self);
00752     }
00753 
00754     return (PyObject *)self;
00755 }
